headline.main: Breach of Promise Case--Verdict for $7,000 Damages.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Cincinnati Commercial, May 26. The case of Miss MARY HEDRICK against HENRY PROTZMAN, to recover damages for a breach of promise to marry, was resumed yesterday, before Judge GHOLSON. Mr. OSBORN and a member of the legal profession, of Lawrenceburg, were examined in relation to the property of the defendant.

headline.main: LAW INTELLIGENCE.; COURT CALENDAR NOTICE. SUPREME COURT. SUPREME COURT--SPECIAL TERM. Large Damages Against a City Railroad Company. SUPERIOR COURT. Casile Garden as an Emigrant Depot. SUPERIOR COURT--SPECIAL TERM--May 28. SUPERIOR COURT--TRIAL TERM--May 28. COMMON PLEAS--CHAMBERS--Monday, May 28.

NEW-YORK CITY.; City Politics--Grand Democratic Demonstration. Prison Association. Horace Greeley in Paris. The Walker Divorce Case. Arrest of Dog "Sharps." Fall of an Old Building--Loss of Life. New-York Young Men's Christian Association. Mayor's Office. The Grand Larceny Case. Inquests. Highway Robbery. Forgery. Burglary in the Second Ward. Alleged Pickpockets. Theft of a Horse and Cart.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Democrats are to have a grand demonstration on Thursday, expressive of their joy at the recent victory in Virginia. One hundred guns will be fired in the Park. In the evening a meeting will be held in Tammany Hall, which will be illuminated on the occasion. The "Hards." it is said, will join in the jubilee Hon. HENRY A. WISE Will, it is confidently anticipated, be present. JAMES T. BRADY and JOHN VAN BUREN,

headline.main: HAVANA.; Movements of the War Steamers--The Captain General on a Tour--A Murderer Garreted--Officers of the Constitution.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have had a good time generally with the Constitution in our harbor, Commander RUDD, with Commodore MAYO aboard, from his command on the coast of Africa. This ship has been singularly fortunate in a cruise of two years and a half upon a sickly coast, with the loss of but two of its complement by disease or accident. One died of a chronic disorder, and the other fell overboard and was drowned at Monrovia.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: SIR: I desire to render my sincerest acknowledgments and thanks in those persons who so generously have responded to an appeal lately made in my behalf by Rev. C. L. BRACE, of the Children's Aid Society, in the columns of your esteemed paper.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Arage--Her Trial Trip. Colored People in City Cars. Concert. Librarian Wanted.

docs.lead_paragraph: At 7 o'clock on Saturday a company of gentlemen went down to Quarantine in the Staten Island ferry boat, and were put on board the new steamship Arago, which immediately proceeded down the bay and some twenty miles to sea on her final trial trip.
